goal: Scenario: College Student Seeking Jokes to Lighten Mood

steps.text: Assign entities to counselor no joke
Jokes.get
Training Phrases:
Tell me some jokes
Joke, please
Have any good jokes?
Tell me a joke, please
Let's hear some funny jokes
Can you tell me a joke, please?
More jokes
Random joke
Tell me the best joke ever
Do you joke well?
Give me a joke
Let's joke
I'm feeling glum, make me laugh
Tell a joke
Tell me a scary joke
Can you tell jokes?
It would be nice to hear a joke right now
Can you joke well?
Do you know any jokes?
Tell me a silly joke
Do you have any jokes?
Tell me a funny joke, please
Tell me your funniest joke
I want to hear a joke
Can you tell me another joke?
I want some jokes
Text Responses:
1. "I told my computer I needed a break, and it replied, 'You and me both!'. We're both overworked."
2. "Why do we tell actors to 'break a leg'? Because every play has a cast. It's the drama of the ER that gets the crowd going."
3. "Did you hear about the mathematician afraid of negative numbers? He'll stop at nothing to avoid them. Guess he never dips below zero in the mood either!"
4. "I’m reading a book on anti-gravity. It's impossible to put down, much like my penchant for dad jokes."
5. "Why don't we ever tell secrets on a farm? Because the potatoes have eyes, the corn has ears, and the beans stalk. It's a privacy nightmare!"
6. "If you see a robbery at an Apple Store, does that make you an iWitness? Just don't sync your testimony."
7. "I’m on a whiskey diet. I've lost three days already. Talk about spirit-ing away your troubles!"
8. "Why was the math book sad? It had too many problems. And here I thought math had the solutions to everything."
9. "Did you know in King Arthur's time, one of the round table knights collected taxes? His name was Sir Charge. Talk about medieval IRS!"
10. "What do you call an alligator in a vest? An investigator. He's also great at snapping up clues."
11. "I told my wife she should embrace her mistakes. She hugged me immediately. Now that's what I call a supportive error message."
12. "Why don’t skeletons fight each other? They don’t have the guts. Plus, their heart's just not in it."
13. "Ever tried to eat a clock? It's very time-consuming, especially if you go for seconds."
14. "I'm reading a horror story in Braille. Something bad is going to happen, I can feel it. It's a touch-and-go situation."

These responses incorporate a mix of affiliative humor, which promotes social bonding, and self-defeating jokes, which humanize the agent by allowing it to poke fun at itself or highlight its limitations, enhancing its relatability and fostering a positive user experience.
Scenario: College Student Seeking Jokes to Lighten Mood
User: "Tell me some jokes."
Bot (Friend): "Sure thing! Here's a joke for you: What do you call an alligator in a vest? An investigator. He's also great at snapping up clues."
User: "That's funny! Do you have another one?"
Bot (Friend): "Glad you liked it! Here's another one: Why was the math book sad? It had too many problems. And here I thought math had the solutions to everything."
User: "Haha, I needed that. Tell me another joke, please."
Bot (Friend): "Of course! Here you go: If you see a robbery at an Apple Store, does that make you an iWitness? Just don't sync your testimony."
User: "Thanks, these are helping me relax."
Bot (Friend): "I'm glad to hear that! Let me know if you want to hear more jokes or if there's anything else I can do for you."
User: "Actually, I think I'm good for now. Thanks for being here, though."
Bot (Friend): "Anytime! Feel free to come back if you need a laugh or just someone to chat with. Take care!"
